page.title: 14Life in the Past.
page.content: In the past it used to be very quiet, there were never any fights or vandalism, everyone used to be well behaved, there were never any strikes. There was no television so a lot of people listened to the radio. Apart from listening to the radio people spent more time in sports. You could travel to Oxford and back for just 5p. A bar of chocolate cost only 1p and a loaf of bread 4p. At Christmas time more parties were held and families would get together. The poor people would pay 6p for the bakers to cook their Sundoy meal. Abingdon was very small. It was a beauty spot. On market day it was very active, lorries came from everywhere to bring food. In Abingdon everyone knew everyone else. The population in Abingdon used to be 9000, today it is 30,000.
